column5: Hooks, Opening scene with Jeramiah trying to catch fish by hand........he was not so successful.......falling in the water with nothing to show for it. It reminds me of the rumor I heard about you trying to catch Pokemon on your trip to Wine Lake last year....... PjShorthorn

Oh yeah, I remember that scene. Jeremiah Johnson is one of my favorites, Pilgrim. "Ever skin Grizz, Pilgrim?" "When ya get done with that one I'll get ya another!" PJ, You've either been talking to Doc or you have been following me. I didn't think anyone was watching. I'm gonna get that Pokeman rascal. No time for fishing! Hooks

Well, I'm embarrassed to admit that my wife bought me a waterproof case for my phone after last year's trip.......I don't even want to get into what I did to one of V-bay Gord's upgrade boat chasing those dang critters. Just a piece of advice, don't mount your cell phone over the depth finder screen...... Even if it is really easy to zip tie your phone to it and the mount is in just the right spot.....you can't see when it goes from 20 to 2 ft quick. PjShorthorn

Definitely A River Runs Through It for me, but grumpy and grumpier old men run a closed second and third. I never knew there was a film version of Old Man And The Sea. I'm going to have to look for that, as I've read the book multiple times. Sent from my SCH-I545 using Tapatalk
There's the horror classic Blood Hook.
How about "Man's Favorite Sport" with Rock Hudson.
I'm sorry but in light of Rock being gay (not that there's anything wrong with that-Seinfeld reference) that sentence struck me as funny.
The book was a lot better.
I have to include Jeremiah Johnson.
Grumpy Old Men! Walter Matthau, Jack Lemmon, Sophia Loren and Ann Margaret and Burgess Meredith. Five great stars
Although not a movie about fishing, one of my favorites containing "fish" is Big Fish. Silly but impactful.
Great movie, but I don't remember fishing being a part of that one.
The Old Man and the Sea.
Having read your book, the lack of women probably would have ruined any sex scenes..... hahahaha
A fish called Wanda.

There was the "scene" with Al & Ernie and the two girls from Moose Lake. My guess is there was a lot more to that story that remains untold, perhaps to protect the innocent. Their Siren call brought the boys back in search of them the following year. They must have been exceptional waitresses.
HAHA... that's right.

All of the movies mentioned are great entertainment. Although not movies, all of trips that I have taken with Gramps ( my Dad ) are as funny as a good movie. He has the uncanny ability to create the funniest moments by just being himself and doing stuff on our trips that just make you shake your head and laugh. So for me, I just relive those memories and laugh my butt off every year when he tries to deflect and blame others for the past moments he created himself.. I do wish I had many of those trips on video tape. It would have been quite a montage by now if I had. PjShorthorn
Funny. I'm getting more like Burgess Meredith. Wife is starting to run faster than me now though. Lucky her.
Sharknado has my vote!!
What about "The Fish That Saved Pittsburgh"?
I just sat through "Bait Shop" on HBO starring Bill Engvall. I can assure you that this is no one's favorite. there's 2 hours of my life I can never get back.
Pat, there are fishing trip stories that can take on near mythical proportions! Part of the draw to the North in my mind! When are you guys going back to VBL?
no doubt about it - the best is bill dance bloopers vol 1 2 3 and 4:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iK_h-2kot6s phish
A river Runs Through It. Jaws and Grumpy Old Men were good too.
Grumpy old men, isn't that the one where the one old boy loses his prized ice fishing pole "the green hornet"? That was a good one.
What about Mr. Limpet?

Fantastic.... Grumpy Old Men is a fantastic move. Here's the best clip of the entire movie... the "bacon skit"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xs00fBj2nH0 "Now according to all of them flat belly experts, I should have took a dirt nap like 30 years ago. But each year comes and goes. And I'm still here... and they keep dying"
The one thing that this thread really made me think about is that there aren't enough fish movies.

A Personal Favorite of mine is and old ,around 1964 Rock Hudson/Doris Day Movie "Mans Favorite Sport".Hudson plays an Outdoorsman who writes many books and recommends fishing and outdoors equipment. He has never fished or been in the outdoors in his life. He is entered in a fishing tournament by his boss and the movie is a comedy of him trying to fish, camp and uphold his life as an Outdoors Expert
Blood Hook.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hg_9e_dvHxU

Great list, Jared! Jaws is an all time classic, but the Grumpy Old Men movies are right up there. Lemmon and Matthau were quite the duo. Too bad they're no longer around. Although not necessarily a "fish" movie, John Candy in "The Great Outdoors" I think would fit this bill. That movie always reminded me of trips to the north woods. I still love watching it. Candy is another one that left too soon.
Thanks for the "plug", Jared, I keep waiting with phone in hand for the Hollywood producer's call. Maybe I should have thrown more sex into the story! Bill
Old man and the SeaMoby Dick
I think you mean Henry Fonda. Can we include FINDING NEMO as a fish movie? That's a good movie when watched with kids or grandkids.
Grumpy Old Men for Sure!
Yes, thanks for reminding me to remember my poor memory. Now I feel stupid. Wait, what was I talking about again?

The relatively recent movie IN THE HEART OF THE SEA, which is based on the true story that inspired Herman Melville to write Moby Dick, did not do well at the box office but should make the list as a "fish" movie. (Yea, I know, whales are mammals not fish).
Grumpy Old Men for sure. The irony is I'm morphing more and more into Walter Mathau every day!
Putz !!!!!! PjShorthorn
Grumpy old men is my pick. The only movie I've watched more times is 8 seconds.
I second the Old man and the sea. I re-read it every couple of years. andersaki
Does "Splash" count?

What say you? A River Runs Through It? Jaws? Grumpy Old Men? The Perfect Storm? Gone Fishing? Something else? Maybe what we need is a less serious topic to get us all excited about fishing again! Personally... A River Runs Through It was one of the best movies I've watched in my entire life. We will just have to wait until "A North Woods Fisherman's Story" comes out on the big screen! If you dont' get that reference... that is WalleyeCentral's very own amazing Bill Krejca's awesome book!
Loved them all but grumpier old men get my vote.
My vote would go to Spencer Tracey in The Old Man and the Sea.
The scene from JAWS where they compare scars is one of my all-time favorite movie scenes, especially when Quint talks about the USS Indianapolis.
Obi, I agree with your list! All good movies I have seen more than once! If they need extras for the North Woods movie, sign me up!
Grumpy Old Men was the only one i've seen. (go figure eh?)
Favorite is definitely Jaws. Liked both Grumpy Old Men movies, too. I remember cracking up when Peter Fonda was cussing at Walter the fish in On Golden Pond. I think I was about 9.
A river runs through it gets my vote. Jared, it must be slow at the All Canada show! I'll be there Sunday collecting brochures and talking to camp owners.
Doesn't open until 3 today. It was actually packed last night! A fantastic day for a Thursday!
Didn't give the opening time a thought. Lol
